citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Upon inspection team arrival at the facility on 6 February 2024 at approximately 11:15 AM, the licensee was immediately
hostile and verbally aggressive. She made repeated demands and insisted that since inspectors were on her property, we
had to do what she told us. APHIS officials stated that if her hostility persisted, we would have to leave the premises. At
this point, an employee offered to take us around and the licensee left the area. After inspecting a small number of dogs
in one area, inspectors observed an adult female sheepdog with a shaved ear and sutures in the pinna. Inspectors asked
the employee to use the facility microchip scanner to identify this dog to determine compliance with adequate veterinary
care regulations. The employee led the inspection team outside to ask the licensee for the scanner. She immediately
became extremely upset, shouting that her "scanner batteries were dead and that she wasn't buying another". She also
insisted that inspectors should "have our own scanner". At this point inspectors explained to the licensee that we would
need access to medical records to assess care for the animals. The licensee immediately refused to allow access to any
records, stating that her "lawyers told her not to let anyone see her records". She was informed that refusal of any part of
the inspection meant refusing the entire inspection. She responded by saying "Well goodbye then". This constituted a
refusal of inspection and the inspection team immediately left the facility.
This inspection and exit interview were refused by the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
JOHN LIES, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
